title: Dobbes Family Estate 2014 Crater View Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Rogue Valley)
description: The winery lays claim to the first planting of Grenache Blanc in Oregon, and has established a track record for consistent quality. Here is a rich, ripe and generously fruity white wine, substantial enough to pair well even with your creamiest sauces. Fleshy pear, apricot and tropical fruits are set against juicy acidity. This is a winner!

title: Domaine Charles Baur 2009 Eichberg Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Softly scented notes of apricot compote entice the nose. The palate is honeyed and pliable, with layers of sweetness and richness. Fresh lemon oil acidity holds against that but overall accentuates the honeyed apricot notes that are the chief theme of this luscious wine.

title: Campo Eliseo 2013 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: While the nose on this barrel-fermented Verdejo is resiny, the oak is of high quality and does a good job accenting minerally apple notes. Lively acidity keeps this fresh, although it's a bit wanting in the midpalate. Flavors of raw oak, vanilla and citrus fruits finish short but with clarity.

title: Silverado 2013 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A thick, rich and balanced expression of great, estate-owned dirt, this wine has well-developed elements of green apple, pear and lemon, with teases of wet stone and gravelly minerality.

title: St Hallett 2013 Black Clay Shiraz (Barossa)
description: An excellent value, this is a fairly full-bodied, slightly creamy-textured Shiraz that should provide ample pleasure through 2020. Smoky, plummy fruit finishes warm and plush.

title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Azul Portugal Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: All the warm southern heat of the Alentejo is in this wine. It is rich, generous and full of ripe, black fruits. Berries and juicy damsons are spiced with pepper, rich tannins and lifted by acidity. It is a wine for big meat dishes, for stews, a powerful, no-holds-barred style. It will be ready to drink from 2017.

title: Château d'Hanteillan 2015 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has a full texture of intense tannins while allowing room for black currant acidity. It has weight and a complex, firm structure that balances fruit and a dry core that hints at wood.

title: Château la Grave 2015 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is fresh, fruity and light in texture. It does show tannins while also having bright acidity and a firm aftertaste.

title: Thomas George 2012 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Raw earth and black tea combine for a classic take on the variety, high-toned in wild strawberry and red cherry. Tightly wound, it opens in the glass, staying light but with texture and body, a floral wine with just enough weight.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Pfersigberg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Softly hinted aromatics of dried peach suggest warmth and ripeness on the nose. The just off-dry palate follows with fluid, gentle richness and a phenolic, textured midpalate. The freshness of the acidity highlights the nuance between very ripe and dried yellow plums. A subtle wine but with a core of subdued richness.

title: Pierre Sparr 2014 Mambourg Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: The nose is an intricate blend of rose petal, sandalwood and the ripe red-speckled skin of plump mirabelle plums. The palate echoes this perfectly, with an off-dry, cushioned and plump feel that just bathes all the senses in ripe fruit. The warm finish again emphasizes the ripe, plump fruit.

title: Tolosa 2013 1772 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Salt, chalk and grapefruit-pith aromas make for a judiciously restrained approach on the nose of this wine, which comes from heritage clones. The palate is mineral-driven with white rock flavors as well as green apple and lime-pith notes.

title: Sadie Family 2012 Pofadder Cinsault (Swartland)
description: Another entry from Sadie's Old Vine Series, this Cinsault leads with wild, earthy aromas of game and savory herbs like sage, bay leaf and rooibos tea that are layered atop the red currant and tart cherry fruit tones. There's a touch of sharpness to the palate, with bright acidity and fine tannins that frame the sour cherry, rhubarb and citrus fruit. Enjoy through 2017.

title: A.A. Badenhorst Family Wines 2012 Secateurs Red Blend Red (Swartland)
description: The Secateurs selections are always attractive wines, and this vintage red doesn't disappoint. Accents of minty cassis, licorice, black tea and leather frame the black berry and cherry core, while lingering suggestions of purple flowers, black tea and sweet spice unfold on the finish. The plush texture and structured yet approachable tannins make this a wine that can be enjoyed now–2018.

title: Adelsheim 2013 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Young and precise, this balances flavors of wild raspberries against a mineral foundation. Suggestions of wet stone and a dash of brown spices come through, with lots of supporting acidity. As it fades, there's a lick of chocolate from aging in 29% new French oak.

title: Airlie 2014 Dry Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley)
description: Truly dry, with barely perceptible 6g/L of residual sugar, this is intensely aromatic. A strong and lingering impression of talcum powder dominates. It's a potent, powerful, penetrating wine, true to variety, but a bit of a challenge with food.

title: August Truth 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A voluptuous wine that's both thick and luxurious, this vineyard-designate reveals hearty elements of crème brûlée and burnt sugar atop grandma's apple pie. It remains in balance through the richness.

title: Château Le Crock 2015 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has a light touch of acidity and a black currant flavor. There are dry tannins that keep the wine firm although don't seem to add weight. The aftertaste is juicy.

title: Château Liot 2015 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine is almost dry in character, with some bitter edges. The weight of the palate gives the wine a sense of strength and power.

title: Château Mouton Rothschild 2015 Aile d'Argent Barrel Sample  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine shows the rich character of Sémillon, cut with attractive, herbal Sauvignon Blanc. It is lively, crisp and succulent.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2012 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: A delicate but earthy nose shows aromas of hibiscus, pencil lead, sagebrush and bay leaf. The palate packs a bright vibrancy, showing flavors of tart cranberry, crushed black pepper, clove, more sagebrush and juniper. This is action-packed but lightly framed.

title: Bernardus 2011 Marinus Red (Carmel Valley)
description: Black and white pepper, boysenberries and roasting pork notes show on the fresh and vibrant nose of this blend of the five red Bordeaux varietals. Light and lively on the palate, it offers lots of boysenberry energy, with more pepper, thyme, cardamom and tea elements. It's a refreshing change of pace from a cool vintage.

title: Campolargo 2012 Os Corvos da Vinha da Costa Red (Bairrada)
description: This is a ripe, full frontal wine, packed with both fruit and tannins. It is structured and rich with blueberry and black currant fruitiness lifted by acidity. The wine's tannins are softening and the wine will shortly be well balanced and delicious. Drink from the end of 2016.
designation: Os Corvos da Vinha da Costa

title: Stolpman 2012 Ruben's Block Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Fresh-cracked pepper and boysenberries show on the nose of this straightforward and ready-to-drink wine, named after renowned vineyard manager Ruben “Grape Whisperer” Solorzano, who lives on the property. The palate packs tart elderberries with woody pencil shavings, black tea and peppery spice.

title: Small and Tall 2012 Liquid Joy Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lime-laced sour cream, brie cheese and pomelo pith show on a nose that is very rind-driven, but brisk more than bitter. The palate on this wine from Clos Pepe Vineyard offers an intriguing, refreshing spectrum of lime blossoms to lime candies, with a restrained hint of tropical gum and guava.

title: Newton 2013 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: New winemaking and a sizable replanting effort at the producer's Spring Mountain estate are starting to show dividends in this new release, a full-bodied style true to its heritage. Bright acidity pops around a taste of pomelo and yuzu, giving the wine a zest of lemon before a caramelized finish.

title: Pazo de Señorans 2011 Colección Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Apple and peach aromas are smooth, sophisticated and minerally. This special-selection, aged Albariño is citrusy but full in body. Orange, nectarine and papaya flavors finish with strong composition. At this stage, this is more about feel, texture and complexity than flavors. Drink now.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2013 Beyra Reserva Tinto Red (Beira Interior)
description: From high altitude vineyards close to Spain, this structured wine has dark tannins and intense mineral notes. The fruit tones are dark in nature, with firm plum skin and blueberry flavors dominated by the dry core of tannins. Age a little longer and drink from 2017.

title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2012 Matthew's Station Vineyard Tannat (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick, firmly structured version of a rare variety in California, smoky in black cherry and vanilla. Perfumed in sweet aromas of violet and raspberry pie, it offers a deceptively balanced fullness of body and power, with persistence to the finish.

title: Livio Felluga 2012 Abbazia di Rosazzo  (Rosazzo)
description: Made with Friulano, Pinot Bianco, Sauvignon, Malvasia and Ribolla Gialla, this structured white opens with enticing aromas of candied citrus zest, light oak, chopped herb and almond. The firm palate offers baked apple, nectarine, coconut, toast, vanilla and a confectionary note.
